required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Sevoflurane and Propofol on the Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Effect of Sevoflurane and Propofol on the Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter in Patients Undergoing Middle Ear Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: In the present study, we compare the effect of sevoflurane and propofol on the optic nerve sheath diameter in patients undergoing middle ear surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of the optic nerve sheath diameter
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after the induction of anesthesia and 1 minute after the end of surgery
primary_outcome.description: The optic nerve sheath of each eye is observed using ultrasound, and the optic nerve sheath diameter is assessed after induction of anesthesia and at the end of surgery.

secondary_outcome.description: Presence and severity of nausea and vomiting is assessed.
Presence and severity of dizziness is assessed.

arm_group.description: Anesthesia is maintained with sevoflurane during the surgery.
Anesthesia is maintained with total venous anesthesia using propofol during the surgery.

intervention.intervention_name: Ultrasound examination of the optic nerve sheath diameter
intervention.description: The optic nerve sheath diameter is examined using ultrasonography.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing middle ear surgery under general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing middle ear surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of cerebrovascular diseases
- Increased intracranial pressure
- History of ophthalmic surgery or diseases
